Allowable Codes:
1 = Moderate white-matter hyperintensity (CHS score 5–6)
2 = Extensive white-matter hyperintensity (CHS score 7–8+)
7 = No white-matter hyperintensity
8 = Unknown/not assessed
9 = Indeterminate
-4 = Not applicable: UDS form submitted did not collect data in this way, or a skip pattern precludes response to this question
Description/derivation: Participants with UDS visits conducted using UDS v1.2 or v2.0 forms will have NACCWMHSEV = -4. Additionally, if imaging, or, more specifically, MR imaging was not used (IMAGINGDX =0 or 1), or if structural imaging findings were not used to support the diagnosis (STRUCTDX = 0) or if there is not evidence of CVD on imaging, then NACCWMHSEV = - 4.
TT code:
If FORMVER <3 then NACCWMHSEV = -4

If FORMVER in (3,4):

If IMAGMWMH=1 or IMAGWMHSEV=1 then NACCWMHSEV=1
If IMAGEWMH=1 or IMAGWMHSEV=2 then NACCWMHSEV=2
If IMAGWMH=0 or (IMAGMWMH=0 and IMAGEWMH=0) then NACCWMHSEV=7
If IMAGWMH=8 or (IMAGMWMH=8 and IMAGEWMH=8) then NACCWMHSEV=8
If IMAGWMH=9 then NACCWMHSEV=9

ELSE NACCWMHSEV = -4

Short Descriptor: Presumptive etiologic diagnosis of the cognitive disorder - Alzheimer's disease
Allowable Codes:
0 = No (assumed assessed and found not present)
1 = Yes
8 = No cognitive impairment
Description/derivation:
Participants with normal cognition have NACCALZD = 8. Participants with any cognitive impairment (dementia, MCI, or impaired, not MCI) and Alzheimer’s disease indicated as the etiologic diagnosis have NACCALZD=1. Participants with cognitive impairment and no Alzheimer’s disease etiologic diagnosis have NACCALZD=0. To determine whether the participant was cognitively impaired, not MCI, or had MCI or dementia, refer to the NACCUDSD variable. 

It is important to note that the criteria for an etiologic diagnosis of Alzheimer’s disease is different across versions of the UDS:
- In v1.2 and v2 the NINCDS/ADRDA criteria were applied
- In v3 and v4 the NIA-AA criteria for AD dementia are applied

While these criteria are quite similar, they do have subtle differences. Please refer to the UDS coding guidebooks for additional information about these different criteria.

Note that variables indicating a diagnosis of probable and possible AD (NINCDS/ADRDA criteria) were collected in UDS v1.2 and v2 and are no longer collected in UDS v3. 

Note that among cognitively or behaviorally impaired participants who had visits assessed using UDS v3 and v4, their clinical syndrome(s) during that particular UDS visit can be determined by examining the following variables: DYEXECSYN, AMNDEM, PCA, NACCPPA, NACCBVFT, NACCLBDS, PSPSYN, CTESYN, CBSSYN, MSASYN, NAMNDEM, OTHSYN.
TT code:
v1-3: no change from current code

v4:
If ALZDIS=1 then NACCALZD=1
If ALZDIS is 0 or blank then NACCALZD=0
If NORMCOG=1 then NACCALZD=8

Short Descriptor: Primary, contributing, or non-contributing cause of observed cognitive impairment - Alzheimer's disease (AD)
Allowable Codes:
1 = Primary
2 = Contributing
3 = Non-contributing
7 = Cognitively impaired but not AD diagnosis
8 = Diagnosis of normal cognition
Description/derivation:
Participants who are cognitively impaired without an etiologic diagnosis of AD have NACCALZP = 7. Unimpaired participants are not assessed for primary, contributing, or non-contributing cause of cognitive impairment and have NACCALZP = 8. To determine whether the participant was cognitively impaired, not MCI, or had MCI or dementia, refer to the NACCUDSD variable. 

It is important to note that the criteria for an etiologic diagnosis of Alzheimer’s disease is different across versions of the UDS:
- In v1.2 and v2 the NINCDS/ADRDA criteria were applied
- In v3 and v4 the NIA-AA criteria for AD dementia are applied

While these criteria are quite similar, they do have subtle differences. Please refer to the UDS coding guidebooks for additional information about these different criteria.
TT code:
v1-3: no change from current code

v4:
If ALZDISIF=1 then NACCALZP=1
If ALZDISIF=2 then NACCALZP=2
If ALZDISIF=3 then NACCALZP=3
If (DEMENTED=1 or MCI=1 or IMPNOMCI=1) and ALZDIS is blank then NACCALZP=7
If NORMCOG=1 then NACCALZP=8

Short Descriptor: Presumptive etiologic diagnosis - Lewy body disease
Allowable Codes:
0 = No (assumed assessed and found not present)
1 = Yes
8 = No cognitive impairment
Description/derivation:
Participants with Lewy body disease indicated as the etiologic diagnosis (DLB or Parkinson’s disease) have NACCLBDE = 1. Participants with normal cognition and no Lewy body disease indicated as the etiologic diagnosis (DLB or Parkinson’s disease) have NACCLBDE = 8. Note that in UDS v4, Parkinson's disease is not assessed as an etiologic diagnosis. To focus on individuals with Parkinson’s disease in UDS v1-3, refer to the variable PARK. In UDS v4, refer to NACCLBDS and LBDSYNT to determine whether participants have Parkinson's disease as a clinical syndrome.

Participants with any cognitive impairment (dementia, MCI, or impaired, not MCI) and Lewy body disease indicated as the etiologic diagnosis (DLB or Parkinson’s disease) have NACCLBDE = 1. Participants with cognitive impairment and no Lewy body disease as an etiologic diagnosis have NACCLBDE = 0. To determine whether the participant was cognitively impaired, not MCI, or had MCI or dementia, refer to the NACCUDSD variable. 

It is important to note that the criteria for an etiologic diagnosis of Lewy body disease is different across versions of the UDS:
- In v1.2 and v2 the McKeith 2005 criteria were applied
- In v3 and v4 the McKeith 2017 are applied

While these criteria are quite similar, they do have subtle differences. Please refer to the UDS coding guidebooks for additional information about these different criteria.

Note that among cognitively or behaviorally impaired participants who had visits assessed using UDS v3 and v4, their clinical syndrome(s) during that particular UDS visit can be determined by examining the following variables: DYEXECSYN, AMNDEM, PCA, NACCPPA, NACCBVFT, NACCLBDS, PSPSYN, CTESYN, CBSSYN, MSASYN, NAMNDEM, OTHSYN.
TT code:
v1-3: no change from current code

v4:
If LBDIS=1 then NACCLBDE=1
If LBDIS is blank then NACCLBDE=0
If NORMCOG=1 then NACCLBDE=8

Short Descriptor: Primary, contributing, or non-contributing cause of cognitive impairment - Lewy body disease (LBD)
Allowable Codes:
1 = Primary
2 = Contributing
3 = Non-contributing
7 = Cognitively impaired but not LBD diagnosis
8 = Diagnosis of normal cognition
Description/derivation:
Participants who are cognitively impaired without an etiologic diagnosis of Lewy body disease have NACCLBDP = 7. Unimpaired participants are not assessed for primary, contributing, or non-contributing cause of cognitive impairment and have NACCLBDP = 8. Participants with any cognitive impairment (dementia, MCI, or impaired, not MCI) and Lewy body disease indicated as the etiologic diagnosis (DLB or Parkinson’s disease) will have NACCLBDP = 1, 2, or 3. To determine whether the participant was cognitively impaired, not MCI, or had MCI or dementia, refer to the NACCUDSD variable.

It is important to note that the criteria for an etiologic diagnosis of Lewy body disease is different across versions of the UDS:
- In v1.2 and v2 the McKeith 2005 criteria were applied
- In v3 and v4 the McKeith 2017 are applied

While these criteria are quite similar, they do have subtle differences. Please refer to the UDS coding guidebooks for additional information about these different criteria.
TT code:
v1-3: no change from current code

v4:
If LBDIF=1 then NACCLBDP=1
If LBDIF=2 then NACCLBDP=2
If LBDIF=3 then NACCLBDP=3
If (DEMENTED=1 or MCI=1 or IMPNOMCI=1) and LBDIS is blank then NACCLBDP=7
If NORMCOG=1 then NACCLBDP=8

Short Descriptor: Does the participant have a dominantly inherited AD mutation?
Description/derivation: This derived variable combines data across all UDS v3 visits and the Neuropathology data, if available. If the participant reported evidence of an AD mutation at any visit (UDS Form D1 Question 8 = 1) or if evidence of an AD mutation is determined at autopsy (NP v1,8,9 Question 19 = 1–3; v10 Question 18p = 1; , v11 Question 19p = 1), then the presence will be indicated in NACCADMU.
TT code:
v1-3: no change from current code

v4: 
If NPPDXP=1 then NACCADMU=1
Else NACCADMU=0

Short Descriptor: Does the participant have a hereditary FTLD mutation?
Description/derivation: This derived variable combines data across all UDS v3 visits and the Neuropathology data, if available. If the participant reported evidence of an FTLD mutation at any visit (UDS Form D1 Question 9 = 1) or if evidence of an FTLD mutation is determined at autopsy (NP v1,8,9 Question 19 = 4; v10 Question 18q = 1 ; v11 Question 19q=1), then the presence will be indicated in NACCFTDM.
TT code:
v1-3: no change from current code

v4: 
If NPPDXQ=1 then NACCFTDM=1
Else NNACCFTDM=0

Short Descriptor: Primary etiologic diagnosis (MCI; impaired, not MCI; or dementia)
